page.title: 11RAILWAYS IN IRWELL VALLEY
page.content:
There are two disused railway lines running through the Irwell Valley.
The{Stubbins-Accrington}line was opened on August 17, 1848 and closed in December 3, 1966.The last train on the Stubbins-Accrington line passed through Helmshore station at 1 am on December 4, 1966 after making the last passenger trip to Bacup.The day before,a special train pulled by steam locomotives had passed along the line.
Although the{Bury-Rawtenstall}line is now closed British Rail and a local preservation group are trying to have the line re-opened. Eventually the line will provide a direct rail link to Bacup.
